element.name: TLegendAlignment
element.short: The legend may be aligned to one of the four corners of the chart.

descr.p: The legend is a list of lines, called legend items. Each item contains a symbol and a text. Symbol is a graphical representation of series or series part. For example, line series use line segment as a symbol, while area series use filled rectangle.

element.name: TChartLegend.Alignment
element.short: Controls location of the legend on the chart.

element.name: TChartLegend.BackgroundBrush
element.short: Used to draw background rectangle of the legend.
element.descr: Set Style to bsClear to get transparent legend.

element.name: TChartLegend.Font
element.short: The font for the legend items text.

element.name: TChartLegend.Frame
element.short: Used to draw a frame around the legend.
element.descr: Set Visible to false to disable frame drawing.

element.name: TChartLegend.Margin
element.short: Distance between the legend's border and the border of chart or sidebar, in pixels.

element.name: TChartLegend.Spacing
element.short: Distance between the legend's border and the items inside, in pixels.
element.descr: Also controls the distance between the consecutive items.

element.name: TChartLegend.SymbolWidth
element.short: Width of the legend's symbols, in pixels.

element.name: TChartLegend.UseSidebar
element.short: If true, the legend is drawn on a separate panel. Otherwise it is drawn over the chart.

element.name: TChartLegend.Visible
element.short: If true, the legend is drawn.

element.name: TLegendItem
element.descr: If you create a new series type, you may specify one of the existing symbol types by overriding GetLegendItems, or create a new symbol by inheriting TLegendItem class.
